    • Method Detail

      • newFileToShelf

        public static PwsFileContainer newFileToShelf(org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsRecordList imports)
        Causes a new password file to be created and displayed in the GUI (includes user passphrase input). Optionally a record import can be performed at the same time. Requires non-EDT thread to perform!
        Parameters:
        imports - PwsRecordList building the initial content of the new database, marked as "IMPORTED"; may be null
        Returns:
        PwsFileContainer the newly installed file or null if installation was not completed
        Since:
        0-5-0

      • openFilePws

        public static org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsFile openFilePws(org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile file,
                                                       DatabaseHandler.FileAccessModus acm)
        Opens a specific Pws database file and makes it available for general purpose. Function is dialog active and asks the user for the passphrase in a loop of possibly multiple access validation attempts. The user is informed in case of passphrase failure, file-not-found or other exceptions. If there exists a cache entry of the requested file in IOManager, the cached instance is returned without asking for password. Can be run on any thread.
        Parameters:
        file - ContextFile of PWS persistent state to be opened
        acm - FileAccessModus method of file retrieving
        Returns:
        a PwsFile object or null if the parameter is void or the user pressed CANCEL during GUI passphrase verification or an IO error occurred

      • openFilePws

        public static org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsFile openFilePws(org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile file,
                                                       org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsPassphrase pass,
                                                       DatabaseHandler.FileAccessModus acm)
        Opens a specific Pws database file with a specific passphrase and makes it available for general purpose. Function is dialog active and the user is informed about passphrase failure, file-not-found or other exceptions. (This method does not request for user input; it can be run on any thread.)
        Parameters:
        url - url of Pws file to be opened
        pass - the PwsPassphrase to access the file
        acm - boolean if true the IO-Manager's database cache is ignored and the file accessed directly via file-IO (still in the framework of the IO-Manager)
        Returns:
        a PwsFile object or null. Returns null if a parameter is void or the operation failed (e.g. due to mismatched passphrase or file-not-found error, etc.)

      • openFileToShelf

        public static void openFileToShelf()
        Lets the user select a PWS database from a file chooser panel and starts a worker task to open it into the GUI shelf. Includes a user passphrase input dialog. Requires EDT to perform!

      • openFileToShelf

        public static PwsFileContainer openFileToShelf(org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile file)
        Opens a specific PWS database from a context file definition of its persistent state and puts it into the GUI framework for user processing. Can be run on any thread.
        Parameters:
        file - ContextFile specification of database file to be loaded
        Returns:
        PwsFileContainer GUI container for given database or null if loading to shelf failed

      • openFileToShelf

        public static PwsFileContainer openFileToShelf(java.lang.String filepath)
        Opens a specific Pws database into the GUI desktop for user processing. The parameter may denote a valid URL expression (any supported protocol) or a local file path. Can be run on any thread.
        Parameters:
        filepath - String database filepath (may be an URL)
        Returns:
        PwsFileContainer GUI container for given database or null if loading to shelf failed

      • openFileToShelf_Url

        public static void openFileToShelf_Url()
        Starts dialog which lets the user setup a URL net connection to a Pws database using a simple text input field. This will open the database into the GUI framework if successful. (Includes user passphrase input.) Requires to run on EDT!

      • openOrNewFile

        public static org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsFile openOrNewFile(java.awt.Component parent,
                                                         java.lang.String title,
                                                         java.io.File dir)
        Brings up a file chooser dialog and lets the user select an existing or define a new PWS file in the local file system. Runs on any thread.
        Parameters:
        parent - owner window to place the dialog
        title - the dialog title (code or real)
        dir - File optional browsing start directory (may be null)
        Returns:
        the opened PWS file or null if failed
        Since:
        0-5-0 modified parameter list

      • passTryOpen

        public static org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsFile passTryOpen(org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile file,
                                                       org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsPassphrase pass,
                                                       DatabaseHandler.FileAccessModus acm)
        Attempts to open the specified file as a PwsFile database. In the first step the specified parameter passphrase is tried. If fails, a user input loop is initiated to query for the correct passphrase. Runs on any thread.
        Parameters:
        file - ContextFile file to be opened
        pass - PwsPassphrase
        directAccess - boolean if true the IO-Manager's database cache is ignored and the file accessed directly via file-IO (still in the framework of the IO-Manager)
        Returns:
        a PwsFile object or null if the attempt failed
        Since:
        0-5-0, 0-6-0 modified parameters

      • putFileToShelf

        public static PwsFileContainer putFileToShelf(org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsFile pws)
        Attempts to add the given database file to the GUI workshelf and load the parameter PWS file as actual work file. Several checks are performed before and after loading, possibly ensuing user information. These checks are: checksum control, invalid records check, expiring records check, file format conversion, check mirror existence. Requires EDT!
        Parameters:
        pws - PwsFile Pws database file to be loaded
        Returns:
        PwsFileContainer GUI container for given database or null if loading to shelf failed
        Since:
        0-5-0

      • reopenFileFromRecents

        public static void reopenFileFromRecents()
        Reopens the most recently used file or a file that comes next to this. The behaviour is dependent on program operation mode (NORMAL or PORTABLE). Runs on any thread.
        Since:
        0-5-0
